how-computers-work-binary-data.title: How Computers Work: Binary & Data
creator: code.org
how-computers-work-binary-data.description: You'll hear that everything's "1s and 0s" in a computer, but what does that mean? Find out how computers represent numbers, words, images, and sound.
concepts: Representing text, images and sound with zeroes and ones (bits).
Bits are how computer input, store, process and output information

images-pixels-and-rgb.title: Images, Pixels and RGB
concepts: With 8 bits we can store 256 numbers from 0 up to 255.

characters-symbols-and-the-unicode-mirac.title: Characters, Symbols and the Unicode Miracle - Computerphile
concepts: A way to represent characters of the english alphabet using binary digits
What is the standard text encoding for the Web

tutorial-1-about-bits-bytes.title: Tutorial 1 About Bits & Bytes
concepts: How storage space is calculated in computers
